meanings.definition: A large fish-eating bird of prey with long wings and a white underside.
meanings.sent1: The osprey soared high in the sky, searching for its next meal.
meanings.sent2: I saw an osprey diving into the water to catch a fish.
meanings.sent3: The osprey decided to take a break from fishing and went for a swim instead.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like those of an osprey, sharp and focused on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The osprey's wingspan was impressive, casting a shadow over the river below.

meanings.definition: A person who is very skilled or successful in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: She was considered the osprey of the art world, with her masterful paintings captivating all who saw them.
meanings.sent2: The young musician proved to be an osprey on the piano, dazzling the audience with his talent.
meanings.sent3: The osprey of the kitchen whipped up a delicious meal in no time.
meanings.sent4: His ability to lead the team to victory made him the osprey of the sports world.
meanings.sent5: Just like an osprey in flight, she excelled effortlessly in her chosen profession.
